Description: Rim and neck sherd of East Greek pottery open vessel, probably krater; dull beige fabric, core sandwiched between wide orange margins, with large quantity of mica and limestone inclusions; yellowish-white slip. Interior reserved with black band at rim; on top of rim, metopal frieze of black squares and crosses separated by double vertical bands; edge of rim painted, underside reserved; on neck (fired red in places) part of geometric pattern (maeander?); streakily glazed to right.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.946)
